title: Business Development Manager Job at HEA Group
content:
HEA Group - We are a multifaceted service group operating across the energy, engineering, and environmental sectors in Nigeria. Our organization delivers comprehensive solutions that span technical project execution, workforce development, and sustainability consulting. With a strong emphasis on safety, quality, and regulatory compliance, we support clients in achieving operational excellence and long-term impact. Our energy services arm offers specialized support in upstream and downstream operations, including project management, procurement, technical manpower supply, and maintenance services. We collaborate closely with industry stakeholders to ensure seamless execution of complex energy projects, leveraging deep sector expertise and a responsive delivery model.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



In the built and industrial environments, we provide expert manpower solutions and engineering support tailored to meet the unique needs of infrastructure, oil and gas, and industrial clients. From staffing critical project roles to managing field operations, our teams are equipped to deliver value at every stage of the project lifecycle. Our environmental division offers strategic advisory, compliance support, and project implementation services across a range of sustainability and environmental management areas. These include environmental impact assessments, audits, waste management, and regulatory liaison, helping clients meet both local and international environmental standards. Driven by innovation, guided by integrity, and committed to excellence, we operate with a unified vision: to be a trusted partner in powering progress, enabling sustainable growth, and delivering value across Nigeria’s key industrial sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager
Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are a leading provider of environmental management, sustainability, and compliance solutions—serving clients across oil & gas, energy, infrastructure, and development sectors.
	Our work balances business performance with environmental responsibility.
	We're seeking a Business Development Manager with strong industry experience and a proven track record in winning business, managing bids, and building key client relationships.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead generation, conversion & BD strategy execution.
	Identify, coordinate & submit high-quality bids/tenders.
	Represent the company at events and client meetings.
	Develop & implement BD and marketing plans.
	Build strong client & partner relationships.
	Conduct market research & analyze trends to unlock new income streams.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s / Master’s Degree in Environmental Science, Engineering or a related field.
	8 - 12 years of experience in Business Development (Environmental Services, Engineering, Energy, or Oil & Gas)
	Solid knowledge of EOI/bid processes
	Strong communication, negotiation & relationship-building skills
	Highly driven, ethical, and detail-oriented.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hea.careers@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Executive Assistant Job at Femaus Consults
content:
Femaus Consults - We are a dynamic brand dedicated to driving excellence across diverse sectors. We specialize in capacity building, recruitment tailored to elevate businesses and organizations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented Executive Assistant to provide comprehensive support to the CEO.
	The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with excellent communication skills, the ability to manage multiple priorities, and a strong sense of discretion and confidentiality.
	This role requires a high level of professionalism, efficiency, and the ability to anticipate the needs of the executive and the organization.


Key Responsibilities
Administrative Support:


	Manage the executive’s calendar, including scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
	Prepare and edit correspondence, communications, presentations, and other documents.
	Maintain and organize files, records, and reports, ensuring confidentiality and accuracy.
	Handle incoming and outgoing communications, including emails and phone calls.


Meeting Coordination:


	Coordinate and prepare materials for meetings, including agendas, presentations, and minutes.
	Attend meetings as required, take detailed notes, and follow up on action items.
	Arrange and manage logistics for both internal and external meetings, including venue booking, catering, and technology setup..


Project Management:


	Assist in the planning and execution of special projects and events.
	Track project timelines, deliverables, and budgets, ensuring deadlines are met.
	Liaise with internal teams and external partners to ensure smooth project execution.


Communication and Liaison:


	Act as the primary point of contact between the executive and internal/external stakeholders.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including clients, partners, and team members.
	Represent the executive in a professional manner, both internally and externally.


Confidentiality and Discretion:


	Handle sensitive information with the highest level of confidentiality and discretion.
	Manage and protect the executive’s personal and professional information


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / BSc Degree with 2 - 4 years of work experience. 


Skills:


	Exceptional organizational and time-management skills.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and other relevant software.
	Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
	Professional demeanor and strong interpersonal skills.
	Ability to multitask and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.
	High level of attention to detail and accuracy.
	Knowledge of graphic design is an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and a Cover Letter detailing their qualifications and experience to: femausconsults@gmail.com using “Executive Assistant” as the subject of the mail.

title: Sales Manager - Real Estate Job at Mshel Homes Limited
content:
Mshel Homes Limited is a real estate development and marketing company incorporated in 2018 with a unique vision to be the leading real estate company in Nigeria, with an outstanding reputation for honesty, integrity and impeccable customer service.

At Mshel Homes Limited our mission is to create a lifetime relationship with our clientele by deliverying property solutions through innovative and technological driven processes that caters to your real estate needs whilst adhering to the highest standards, systems and performance goals necessary to achieving your dreams.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Manager - Real Estate
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Ikate, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly experienced Sales Manager with a proven track record of consistently closing deals and exceeding sales targets.

title: Supply Chain and Operations Specialist Job at Castville Solutions
content:
Castville Solutions is a recruitment and business solutions provider specializing in the healthcare sector. We focus on connecting healthcare facilities with highly skilled professionals, enabling efficient operations, and driving business growth. Our services extend to recruitment, Templates for process and operations management, SOP development, and healthcare-specific training, with a clear mission to transform the healthcare workforce and operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain and Operations Specialist

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking for a highly motivated and experienced Supply Chain and Operations Specialist to join our dynamic healthcare organization.
	This role requires strong leadership capabilities and a proven track record ofmanaging complex supply chain operations in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities – Supply Chain Operations Specialist
Lead and Coordinate End-to-End Supply Chain Activities:


	Oversee the entire supply chain process from procurement, inventory management, warehousing, and distribution of healthcare products and medications.
	Ensure seamless coordination between suppliers, logistics partners, internal stakeholders, and healthcare facilities to meet delivery timelines.
	Anticipate and resolve supply chain disruptions or delays to maintain product availability and patient care standards.


Optimize Operational Workflows:


	Analyze current supply chain operations and identify inefficiencies or bottlenecks in procurement, inventory, and distribution processes.
	Implement improved workflows that streamline operations, reduce cycle times, and minimize wastage or stock-outs.


Enhance Performance, Reduce Costs, and Improve Service Levels:


	Collaborate with procurement and finance teams to negotiate favorable terms with vendors and suppliers while maintaining product quality.
	Monitor inventory turnover rates and implement demand forecasting methods to optimize stock levels and reduce holding costs.


Manage Cross-functional Teams and Foster Collaboration:


	Facilitate regular communication between departments to align supply chain activities with clinical and operational needs.
	Provide training, mentorship, and performance feedback to team members to foster a high-performing supply chain team culture.


Monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):


	Establish and track key supply chain metrics such as order fulfillment rate, inventory accuracy, supplier performance, lead time, and logistics costs.
	Use dashboards and reporting tools to provide real-time visibility into supply chain performance.


Implement Continuous Improvement Strategies:


	Conduct regular audits and root-cause analyses to drive quality and efficiency across the supply chain.
	Initiate cost-saving initiatives and operational innovations in response to market changes or internal challenges.


Ensure Regulatory Compliance and Policy Adherence:


	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry regulations, including Good Distribution Practices (GDP), healthcare logistics standards, and pharmaceutical handling guidelines.


Risk Management and Business Continuity:


	Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies for supply chain disruptions, such as supplier failures, transport delays, or product recalls.
	Create contingency and emergency response plans to ensure continuity of medical supply chains during crises or pandemics.
	Collaborate with the quality and compliance teams to manage product recalls, shortages, or stock rationalizations.


Stakeholder Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain effective relationships with suppliers, third-party logistics providers, and internal stakeholders.
	Act as a key point of contact for escalations and issue resolution related to supply chain activities.
	Evaluate and onboard new vendors and service providers based on performance, compliance, and value delivery.


Reporting and Strategic Planning:


	Provide regular performance reports and updates to senior leadership on supply chain metrics and improvement initiatives.
	Contribute to the development of strategic supply chain plans aligned with overall organizational goals.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain Management, Operations, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in supply chain and operations, with at least 2 years in a leadership role.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, highly proactive.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


Note: For more information or enquiries, call or send a WhatsApp message to: 09010634633.

title: Job Openings at Dana Group
content:
Dana Group isa major Nigerian conglomerate with a diverse range of businesses spanning manufacturing, aviation, automotive, and pharmaceuticals.It's known for its contributions to Nigeria's industrialization and has diversified into various sectors over its history.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Regulatory Pharmacist

Job Location: Oshodi - Isolo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develops strategies and procedures to ensure regulatory compliance.
	Ensure all legal and regulatory documents are filed and monitor compliance with laws and regulations.
	Responsible for authorisation of production, Batch Manufacturing Record (BMRs), and document review
	Make sure all professional activities undertaken by you or under your control are covered by adequate professional indemnity cover.
	Ensures Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) is adhered to
	Registration of products with the National Agency for Food Drugs. Administration and Control (NAFDAC)
	Ensure that Production and manufacturing operations are carried out in compliance with the current WHO GMP, National Regulatory Authority Standard (NAFDAC, PCN, Federal Ministry of Labour and Productivity), and NIS ISO 9001:2015.
	Liaising with bodies such as the Pharmaceutical Group of the Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (PMGMAN), National Agency for Food Drugs Administration and Control (NAFDAC), Pharmacists Council of Nigeria (PCN), Pharmaceutical Society of Nigeria (PSN), Federal and State Ministries of Health, Customs and Excise Authorities
	Handling of market complaints with QC/QA
	Stay abreast of GMP, Pharmacovigilance, and CGMP guidelines regarding product development and compliance
	Processing and obtaining chemical permit for Dana Group of companies
	Oversee the registration and renewal of the premises (Including Warehouse) license with the Pharmacist Council of Nigeria (PCN) annually as contained in chapter 152 of the pharmacy law.
	Oversee the activities of the regulatory unit as it concerns compliance, registration, and renewal of licenses.
	Ensure that all legal and professional requirements covering operations in the premises are adhered to
	Guiding the management and internal clients to comply with regulatory requirements
	Participation in advocacy, public corporate responsibility programmes and maintains a cordial relationship with stakeholders in our business.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a B. Pharm Degree with 5 years of work experience. 


Application Closing Date: 24th June, 2025. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: vacancies@danagroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Marketing Executive

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly motivated and creative Marketing Executive to join our organization. 
	The successful candidate will be responsible for developing, implementing, and overseeing marketing strategies and campaigns to promote our products and services. 
	This role requires a strong understanding of market trends, consumer behavior, and competitor analysis.


Responsibilities
Marketing Strategy and Planning:


	Develop and improve upon existing marketing strategies to maximize company profit
	Conduct market research to assess current trends, brand awareness, and competitor ventures
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to achieve business goals.


Event Management and Activation:


	Support events and activation programs to enhance brand visibility and customer engagement
	Coordinate and oversee promotional events, exhibitions, and communication campaigns.


Advertising and Media:


	Monitor ads like TV, Radio, Social media, etc. to ensure consistent brand messaging
	Oversee content creation for publication across various marketing channels.


Marketing Assets and Materials:


	Monitor the functionality and wellbeing of marketing assets like gift items, display stands, T-shirts, face caps, and other materials
	Ensure adequate availability of Point of Sale (POS) materials when needed.


Vendor Relationship Management:


	Conduct competitive market research to inform marketing strategies
	Maintain good rapport with professionals from other automobile companies and vendors
	Manage vendor relationships to ensure effective collaboration.


Data Management and Advertising Initiatives:


	Manage all data and advertising initiatives to optimize marketing performance
	Analyze data to track performance, measure user engagement, and refine marketing strategies.


Record Keeping and Financial Management:


	Maintain accurate record keeping of all marketing bills and payments
	Ensure timely payment and reconciliation of marketing expenses.


Content Creation and Publication:


	Oversee content creation for publication across various marketing channels
	Ensure consistent brand messaging and tone across all marketing materials.


Requirements


	BSc / BA / HND in Marketing, Business Administration, or relevant field
	Experience: Proven experience as a Marketing Executive or similar role.


Skills:


	Good understanding of market research techniques, data analysis, and statistics methods
	Thorough knowledge of strategic planning principles and marketing best practices
	Proficient in MS Office and marketing software (e.g., CRM)
	Ability to Meet Set Goals/Targets
	Strong organizational and time-management abilities
	Familiarity with social media and web analytics (e.g., WebTrends)
	Excellent communication and people skills
	Creativity and commercial awareness.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 per month.

Application Closing Date: 17th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified applicants are to send their CV to: vacancies@danagroup.com using the Job Position as subject of the email.

Note: If you are a motivated and creative individual with a passion for marketing, we encourage you to apply for this excitingopportunity.

 

 

3.) Security Officer

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking an experienced and skilled Security Supervisor to join our team at Dana Pharmaceuticals, in Ibadan.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing the security operations of our organization, ensuring the safety and security of our employees, assets, and premises.


Responsibilities
Supervise Security Personnel:


	Oversee and manage a team of security guards
	Ensure that security personnel are properly trained and equipped to perform their duties.


Security Operations:


	Monitor and respond to security breaches or incidents
	Conduct regular patrols and inspections of premises
	Ensure that security protocols and procedures are followed.


Risk Management:


	Identify potential security risks and vulnerabilities
	Develop and implement strategies to mitigate security risks.


Emergency Response:


	Respond to emergency situations such as intrusions, fires, or medical emergencies
	Coordinate with emergency services as needed.


Record Keeping:


	Maintain accurate records of security incidents and breaches
	Prepare and submit security reports as required.


Collaboration:


	Work closely with other departments to ensure a safe and secure working environment
	Liaise with law enforcement agencies and other external stakeholders as needed.


Requirements / Qualifications


	National Diploma (ND) in any field
	Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in a security supervisory role.
	Previous Experience is an added advantage


Skills:


	Strong leadership and management skills
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
	Familiarity with security protocols and procedures.


Application Closing Date: 24th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: vacancies@danagroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
